resources.string: Miami is an international city at the southeastern tip of the United States.

Miami is a major metropolitan city located in the southeastern United States in the state of Florida. It is one of the most popular tourist destinations for domestic and international travelers. What makes it unique is its blend of big city life in a tropical setting. Its location on the tip of the continental U.S. is only a few hours away from major cities in Latin America and the Caribbean Islands. Furthermore, a vast influx of immigrants for decades from these countries have helped shape Miami’s uniqueness and flavor compared to other cities in the U.S.
The art deco nighclub district is regarded as one of the best tourist spots in the world.

South Beach is known for its beaches and the glamorous scene around its happening nightspots and celebrity-chef eateries. Ocean Drive is well known for its art deco style architecture and several outdoor cafes. South Beach has been dubbed the American Riviera.
A taste of the Renaissance in the middle of a city.

Built in 1916 as a winter retreat, this lavish villa is a tribute to the Italian Renaissance. The museum contains much of the original furnishings and artwork, and is surrounded by lush, formal gardens.
Celebrate Latin culture and history in Miami.

Calle Ocho (8th Street) is the unofficial capital of Miami’s Cuban community. Located in the Little Havana neighborhood in Miami, it is the heart of the vibrant Cuban community in Miami, who have influenced the city throughout the decades. The neighborhood contains various cafes, restaurants and art galleries that transform one into a different time and place.
Experience open-air shopping by the waterfront.
Bayside Marketplace is two-story open air marketplace located in the Downtown Miami area. The banks of Biscayne Bay wrap around the property with the City of Miami marina at its side.
Shop at more than 100 luxury retailers in a tranquil atmosphere.

Bal Harbour Shops is an exquisite collection of designer boutiques and restaurants in a tropical garden setting. An internationally renowned shopping destination, it’s a favorite playground for socialites, fashionistas, and celebrities.
The place to shop, eat, drink, and people watch.

Located just a few blocks off South Beach, Lincoln Road Mall is South Florida’s premier outdoor shopping, dining, and entertainment destination. This mile long, pedestrian-only promenade boasts a happening street scene with throngs of local and out-of-town visitors, excellent shopping, and terrific dining options.
You are never more than 60 miles from a beach in South Florida.

The characteristics of Miami\'s many beaches are as varied as the city\'s population: There are beaches for swimming, socializing, or serenity; for family, seniors, or gay singles; some to make you forget you\'re in the city, others darkened by huge condominiums. Whatever type of beach vacation you\'re looking for, you\'ll find it in one of Miami\'s several beaches.
The Everglades comprise the largest subtropical wetland ecosystem in North America.

Everglades National Park is a 1.5-million-acre wetlands preserve on the southern tip of the U.S. state of Florida. Often compared to a grassy, slow-moving river, the Everglades is made up of coastal mangroves, sawgrass marshes and pine flatwoods that are home to hundreds of animal species. Airboat rides and tours are the most popular ways to see and experience this natural beauty.
The Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico meet here.
The southernmost point in the United States, just 90 miles north of Cuba, Key West is famous for watersports, lively nightlife, beaches and historic sites.
Whitehead St and South Street, Key West, FL 33040
The only swimming pool listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
A Venetian-style lagoon carved out of coral rock, this historic landmark and swimming pool features caves, stone bridges and waterfalls, creating a tropical backdrop.
2701 De Soto Blvd, Coral Gables, FL 33134
75 years of history as an Art Deco classic at the center of South Beach.
Party like a South Beach rockstar when you book a room at the Clevelander Hotel. It\’s located in the middle of Ocean Drive. The pool and patio bar is famous for people watching day or night.
The 18,000 square foot club is one of Miami\'s most exclusive clubs.

LIV at Fontainebleau is consistently ranked one of the top nightclub venues in the world and has redefined Miami Beach and pioneered the nightlife experience. The trendy, opulent Fontainebleau Hotel club is where DJs spin at parties that attract celebs and VIPs.
Soak up the sun on luxurious day beds while enjoying lunch and creative cocktails.

Hot spot on the beach offering seafood amid chic decor plus a DJ-fueled scene at night. One of South Beach’s most elite clubs, Nikki Beach Miami is located directly on the beach. With torches, palm trees, sand under your feet and the sky as your roof, few things get better than this.
